summary: Build an AI application that can perform any task or function requested by the user.
architectural_notes: Public share URL is rockhogtv.caffeine.xyz (use as canonical link for share/copy actions).

existing_features.title: Create the RockHog TV app shell with navigation for the five content categories: Music, Gaming, Sports, Horror, and Adult.

Implement a no-code creator/admin workflow in the UI to add and manage channels/streams, including: title, category (Music/Gaming/Sports/Horror/Adult), description, thumbnail image upload, and a stream source URL/embed code field.
Build viewer-facing browsing and watch pages: category listings (cards with thumbnail/title) and a stream detail page that renders the provided stream source (URL/embed) plus channel metadata.
Add Adult content gating: require an explicit age/consent confirmation before viewing Adult category listings and Adult stream pages, and show a content warning on entry.
Implement "Bacon Cash" as an in-app virtual currency balance per viewer account, including balance display in the UI and backend persistence.

Add a "Buy Bacon Cash" flow that lets viewers request a top-up amount and records a purchase request in the backend for fulfillment (since no payment rails were specified). Include an admin-only screen to mark requests as completed and credit the user’s balance.
Add authentication via Internet Identity and basic roles/permissions: viewer (default), creator (can manage own channels), admin (can fulfill Bacon Cash requests and moderate/delete any channel).
Define and apply a coherent visual theme for RockHog TV (distinct, consistent colors/typography/layout) suitable for an entertainment streaming hub, avoiding a blue/purple default.
Generate and include static branding/category artwork (logo + category icons + a hero/banner) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (not via backend).
Add a user-visible sharing control that lets users share RockHog TV by copying a link to the clipboard (and using the native share sheet when supported).
Add a new viewer-accessible "Contact" page that displays the site owner contact information (email address: brianlellis24@gmail.com) without any contact form or email-sending capability.
Add an in-app navigation entry point to the new Contact page from the global layout (footer is acceptable) so users can find it from anywhere in the app.
Update the Creator Studio page to display each channel’s live streaming ingest URL and stream key in a clear, copy-friendly UI section (e.g., labeled read-only fields with a “Copy” action).

Add a new playable game area to the existing app as a browser-based action game prototype inspired by (but not copying) fighting-game and tactical-shooter gameplay, with original characters and assets (no Mortal Kombat / Call of Duty IP, names, likenesses, or maps).

Implement the core gameplay loop for the prototype: player movement + aiming + shooting with guns that fire bacon-bit projectiles instead of bullets, including projectile travel, hit detection, and basic health/damage rules.

Provide cross-device controls suitable for PC and mobile browsers: keyboard/mouse controls on desktop and touch controls on mobile (e.g., virtual joystick + fire button), with responsive layout and sensible defaults.

Add at least one simple opponent target (AI or stationary/moving dummy) so bacon-bit shooting can be tested end-to-end, plus minimal HUD elements (health, ammo or cooldown, and a score/round indicator).
Persist a minimal per-user game stat (e.g., best score or total eliminations) to the backend for authenticated users, and show it in the game UI; guests can still play but do not persist stats.
Create and apply a cohesive visual theme for the new game experience (menus/HUD/background styling) that fits a bacon-themed action arena and is distinct from the existing RockHog TV streaming look.
Replace the current single-action Bacon Ops start screen with a simple in-game main menu that includes a clear mode selection UI before starting gameplay.

Add a game mode concept to the Bacon Ops game initialization so the selected mode changes the initial game setup (at minimum: enemy configuration and/or win/lose rules) while keeping the existing Arena gameplay unchanged by default.
Ensure best-score persistence continues to work for authenticated users without regressions when adding modes, and define which mode(s) are eligible for best-score updates.
Remove the Bacon Ops game entry point from the app UI by deleting the "Bacon Ops" navigation button and any other links that route users to the Bacon Ops game.
Remove the Bacon Ops route from the application router so the path "/bacon-ops-arena" is no longer registered.
Remove the Bacon Ops game UI and engine code from the frontend so it is no longer compiled or shipped (BaconOpsArenaPage and the frontend/src/game/baconOps subtree).
Remove Bacon Ops best-score query/mutation hooks and any backend calls used exclusively for Bacon Ops gameplay (e.g., getBestScore/updateBestScore) from the frontend data layer.
Remove the Bacon Ops navigation entry point from the UI so users cannot navigate to the Bacon Ops game (delete the "Bacon Ops" button/link wherever it appears, including the primary navigation).

Remove the Bacon Ops game UI page and engine code from the frontend build so it is no longer compiled or shipped (remove BaconOpsArenaPage and the entire frontend/src/game/baconOps subtree and any remaining imports/references).

Remove Bacon Ops best-score React Query hooks and any frontend backend calls used exclusively for Bacon Ops gameplay (remove useGetBestScore/useUpdateBestScore and any references to getBestScore/updateBestScore).
Extend the channel category system to support the following new categories end-to-end (creation/editing, storage, and retrieval): Radio, DJs, IRL, Audio & Video Podcasts, and PPV Events.
Update the main (home) page category browsing section to include clickable entries for Radio, DJs, IRL, Audio & Video Podcasts, and PPV Events, alongside the existing categories.

Update the Creator channel editor category dropdown to include Radio, DJs, IRL, Audio & Video Podcasts, and PPV Events as selectable options, using clear English labels (e.g., "IRL", "DJs", "PPV Events", "Audio & Video Podcasts").
Update category display naming so that category pages and UI badges show appropriate English capitalization for the new categories (e.g., "IRL" not "Irl", "DJs" not "Djs", "PPV Events" not "Ppv").

Add new static category icon assets for Radio, DJs, IRL, Audio & Video Podcasts, and PPV Events, and render them via the existing CategoryIcon component mapping (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).
Add a new desktop-focused Sign Up page for RockHog TV that explains account creation and lets a user start registration by authenticating with Internet Identity.
Add a desktop-only entry point to the Sign Up page for logged-out users in the global header area (visible on md+ breakpoints; hidden on mobile).
Create a new AI Chat page with a conversational interface where users can type natural language requests and receive AI-generated responses
Implement conversation history persistence so authenticated users can view and continue previous AI chat sessions
Add a primary navigation entry point to the AI Chat page so users can access it from anywhere in the app
Create a cohesive visual theme for the AI Chat interface that is distinct from the RockHog TV streaming experience and emphasizes clarity, focus, and conversational interaction

Create React Query hooks for chat room operations: useGetChatRooms to fetch all chat rooms, useGetChatRoomMessages to fetch messages for a specific room with polling enabled for real-time updates, and usePostMessage mutation to send new messages

Create a ChatRoomPage component that displays a list of available chat rooms in a sidebar, shows the selected room's message history in the main area with sender names and timestamps, and includes a ChatInput component at the bottom for sending messages

Add a route for the chat room page at /chat-room in the application router and add a primary navigation entry point labeled 'Chat Room' in the PrimaryNav component so users can access it from anywhere in the app

Create a cohesive visual theme for the chat room interface that emphasizes real-time communication and community interaction, using distinct colors and styling from both the RockHog TV streaming experience and the AI Chat interface

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an all-in-one live streaming platform (no-code)
Support content categories/channels: music, gaming, sports, horror, and adult content
Add purchasable viewer virtual currency called "Bacon Cash"
Add a shareable RockHog TV link (e.g., copy/share button) so users can easily share the site/app
Add a non-email 'Contact / Site Owner' page that displays the owner's contact info (e.g., brianlellis24@gmail.com) without a contact form or email sending
Add live streaming key and ingest URL information to the Studio page (for creators/admins)

Extend the channel data model to include live streaming connection info: an ingest URL and a stream key, and ensure these values are returned whenever channels are fetched (getChannel/getAllChannels/getMyChannels). Existing channels must remain readable after upgrade.

Remove Bacon Ops game-stat functionality from the backend by deleting the getBestScore and updateBestScore methods and removing any Bacon Ops-only user profile fields (bestScore) that are no longer needed.

Remove Bacon Ops game-stat functionality from the backend by deleting the getBestScore and updateBestScore methods and removing any Bacon Ops-only user profile fields (bestScore) that are no longer needed, while keeping the rest of RockHog TV functionality working.
Add new main-page sections/categories for Radio, DJs, IRL, Audio & Video Podcasts, and PPV Events (PPV)
Add a desktop sign-up page (user registration) to RockHog TV
Create an AI-powered app that can handle any user request or task
Add a backend AI service integration endpoint that accepts user prompts and returns AI-generated text responses
Add a live chat room for real-time user communication

Create a new ChatRoom data type in the backend that stores chat room metadata (room ID, room name, creation timestamp) and an array of chat messages (message ID, sender principal, sender display name, message text, timestamp)
Add backend methods to create a new chat room, retrieve all chat rooms, retrieve messages for a specific chat room by ID, and post a new message to a chat room (authenticated users only)
Initialize at least one default chat room (e.g., 'General Chat' or 'RockHog Lounge') during backend initialization so users have a place to chat immediately after the feature is deployed
